usefulItems: silicone bread mat, plastic wrap, bowl, rolling pin, baking paper, baking tray (30 x 40 cm), pastry brush, refrigerator, oven
title: Family chicken galette

ingredients.content: 200 g unsalted butter, frozen and cut into pieces (1-2 cm)
200 g plain flour,  plus extra for dusting
110 g bacon rashers, cut into strips (2 cm)
250 g brown onion, cut into eighths, layers separated
220 g sweet potato, peeled and cut into cubes (2 cm)
3 sprigs fresh thyme, leaves only, plus extra for garnishing
150 g fresh Swiss brown mushrooms, cut into quarters

preparations.content: Place all pastry ingredients into mixing bowl and mix <b>20 sec/speed 6<b>.

Transfer pastry dough onto a lightly floured silicone bread mat or work surface, then shape into a ball. Wrap pastry in plastic wrap and place into refrigerator to rest for 20 minutes. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Place garlic into mixing bowl and chop <b>3 sec/speed 7<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.

Add all remaining caramelised onion ingredients and cook <b>10 min/Varoma//speed <b>. Cook for a further <b>10 min/Varoma//speed <b>, <b>without measuring cup<b>. Transfer mixture into a bowl and set aside.

Place 500 g of the water into mixing bowl. Place Varoma into position and weigh chicken and sweet potato into it. Scatter thyme leaves over chicken and sweet potato, and season with salt and pepper. Secure Varoma lid and steam <b>10 min/Varoma/speed 1<b>. Stir chicken and sweet potato to ensure even cooking.
Add mushrooms to Varoma. Secure Varoma lid and steam <b>5 min/Varoma/speed 1<b>. Remove Varoma and set aside to cool. Discard water.
Place butter, flour, stock paste, cream and remaining 100 g water into mixing bowl and cook <b>4 min/90°C/speed 4<b>.

Cut cooled chicken into pieces (2-3 cm). Add chicken, sweet potato and mushrooms to mixing bowl and combine <b>10-15 sec//speed 1<b> or until combined. Set aside to cool in mixing bowl while rolling pastry.

Transfer dough onto a lightly floured piece of baking paper (30 x 40 cm) and roll out dough into a circle (40 cm diameter and approx. 5 mm thick). Transfer baking paper with pastry onto a large baking tray (30 x 40 cm).
Spread cooled onion mixture onto pastry, leaving a 5 cm border on all sides. Place cooled chicken mixture on top of onion mixture.

Fold over pastry border, pleating pastry as you fold to create a crust, and garnish filling with extra thyme leaves. Brush pastry border with milk and bake for 25 minutes (200°C) or until pastry is puffed and golden. Leave to cool for 5-10 minutes before serving.

hintsAndTricks: Please refer to The Basic Cookbook or Everyday Cookbook for the Chicken stock paste recipe.
